node.statement: STEP 4 (QED): Verify the equality 1/Phi_2(r) = 1/Phi_2(p) + 1/Phi_2(q). From Step 1 (node 1.4.1): 1/Phi_2(p) = (b-a)^2/2 and 1/Phi_2(q) = (d-c)^2/2. From Step 3 (node 1.4.3): 1/Phi_2(r) = ((b-a)^2 + (d-c)^2)/2. Direct arithmetic: 1/Phi_2(p) + 1/Phi_2(q) = (b-a)^2/2 + (d-c)^2/2 = ((b-a)^2 + (d-c)^2)/2 = 1/Phi_2(r). Therefore 1/Phi_2(r) = 1/Phi_2(p) + 1/Phi_2(q), establishing that equality holds in the main inequality (node 1) for n=2. This completes the base case. QED.
